data.title: Harold Cheney Obituary - Oak Harbor, Washington
data.meta_description: Wallin-Stucky  Funeral Home n opened November 8, 2010 to serve the residents of Whidbey Island and beyond. Our new, state of the art facility is located at 1811 NE 16th Ave, Oak Harbor, WA. In January 2018, to serve our south end families, we opened a branch in Freeland, WA.
data.text:
HAROLD LLOYD CHENEY

Harold Lloyd Cheney, age 87, died at home on February 22, 2011. He was born in Lusk, Wyoming on April 5, 1923 to Lloyd and Lillian (Leeling) Cheney. Harold left school on September 16, 1940 and enlisted in the U. S. Army. Following boot camp, he was sent to Iran, where he served as a warehouseman for three years. He was discharged as a Sergeant on July 15, 1945.

Harold returned to Lusk and on September 15, 1945, he married Jean LaFawn Carpenter. Harold’s father had been hired to work on the construction of NAS Whidbey, and Jean and Harold soon followed him to Oak Harbor. Harold found work as a laborer at the base and the Cheney’s began to raise their family.

Harold left the base and began work at Hayward Auto as an auto body mechanic. He later moved on to the Chevrolet Garage, continuing his work as an auto body repairman. He finished his career at Trico Plumbing and Heating. Harold was a great outdoors man, with a love of hunting, fishing, archery, camping and reading. He also enjoyed collecting arrowheads.

Harold is survived by his wife of sixty-five years, Jean, at the family home and by four children and their spouses: Sheryl and Rod Kammenga of Bellingham; Mickey and Gene Sieffert of Oak Harbor; Harold “Dale” Cheney of Twisp and Karen and Jack McLarkey of Camden, Arkansas. Eight grandchildren and fourteen great grandchildren also survive. His parents, three sisters and one brother preceded him in death.

Harold requested no formal funeral services be conducted. Cremation was held with burial to follow at Maple Leaf Cemetery. Friends and family are encouraged to share memories and condolences at www.wallinfuneralhome.com. Arrangements are entrusted to Wallin Funeral Home, Oak Harbor.
